column4: the problem is the following: i'm getting sound (like from xmms) and amorok, but I am not able to change the volume
it just sounds on the maximum..and thats all
double-click on the volume icon, and see if it changes when you adjust the PCM or PC speaker.
Then right-click the volume control icon and select the device you want to adjust (sometimes Ubuntu doesn't detect which hardware is it supposed to adjust).
try the other controls.
they do not do anything
in xmms in the options i am using out put plugin: ALSA 1.2.10 (libALSA.so)
I'm using the OSS output plugin
maybe you need more plugins?
when i pull the volume regulater all the way down, it mutes
what happens when it's all the way up?
so it's all or nothing
I think one of the controls regulate the volume.
yup
depends on your sound card, of course.
